attributes.action: THE UK GOVERNMENT MUST INTERVINE TO SAVE KURDISTAN
attributes.additional_details:
For the first time in their history, the Iraqi people had a permanent constitution in 2005, which was agreed upon by all of the political parties and was approved by 80% of the Iraqis.
If that constitution was used as a landmark for solving any legal, political and constitutional disputes between Iraq and Kurdistan and the deferent fractions of the Iraqi Mosaic, the whole of Middle East would have been a safer neighborhood.
attributes.background: In the past 100 years all of the Iraqi consecutive governments have used force to settle the Kurdish peoples quest for freedom, but after the invasion of Iraq in 2003 the Kurdish people willingly went back to Iraq to start all over again.
